designations.source: A review of the beetles of Great Britain: Ground Beetles (Carabidae)
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the national status of ground beetles using IUCN methodology for assessing threat. It covers all species of Carabidae in Great Britain, identifying those that are rare and/or under threat as well as non-threatened and non-native species.
designations.reporting_category: Nationally Scarce, Nationally Rare and Other Species
designations.designation: Nationally Rare. Includes Red Listed taxa
designations.designation_description: Nationally Rare - Occurring in 15 or fewer hectads in Great Britain. Includes rare species qualifying under the main IUCN criteria.

designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Taxa which do not qualify for Lower Risk (conservation dependent), but which are close to qualifying for Vulnerable. In Britain, this category includes species which occur in 15 or fewer hectads but do not qualify as Critically Endangered, Endangered or Vulnerable.
designations.comments: There are post-1980 records from 6 hectads. There are pre-1980 records from 9 hectads.  The 'lost' squares in Dorset and South Hampshire mostly contain only very old records. During the post-1980 period, the species has been discovered at new sites in Surrey, West Sussex and West Norfolk suggesting it has either been much overlooked or is undergoing range expansion. Nevertheless, this remains a very rare species which conservationists and site managers know too little about.
